alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 12:57PM EST until January 14 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN ESSEX...SOUTHWESTERN LAMOILLE...NORTHWESTERN ADDISON AND CENTRAL CHITTENDEN COUNTIES... At 1256 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Sloop Island to Olmstedville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 72 and 86. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Vergennes, South Burlington, Moriah, Crown Point, Westport, Weybridge, Monkton Ridge, Monkton, Monkton Boro, Essex Junction Village, Williston, New Haven, Port Henry, Addison, Hinesburg, St. George, Shoreham, Ferrisburg, and Charlotte. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
